proc:P3AModificationItemGroup.proc:Description:
BLII quantities represent the number of operational sites that are touched each FY. Unit cost fluctuations are a direct result of the wide variation of number of users per site as well as the type of effort being funded/equipment being refreshed.
[Base Level Information Infrastructure (BLII) Tech Refresh/Integration] Base Level Information Infrastructure Technical Refresh (BLII/IT005): FY16 funding is provided for the technical refresh of existing antiquated network equipment and infrastructure that resides on the OCONUS Navy Network (ONE-NET), along with related US Navy pier side infrastructure, for transition to a common Navy Networking Environment (NNE) through the institution of a single approved service operating model in conjunction with the Next Generation Enterprise Network (NGEN). Funding will allow for the refresh of 10,000+ antiquated PCs which will be at the end of their warranty, and 3,000+ network devices that have reached end of life/support and now present security risks to the network. FY16 funding will allow for the procurement and upgrade of additional emergent security and network management capabilities such as Configuration Management (CM) 2012 monitoring, Remedy Interface and ITSM Eradication, Windows Server 2008/CM2012 Server Management, BackUp Executive Replacement and Server Farm Refresh Life Cycle. FY16 funding will provide for the required Systems/Security Engineering and Integration, Production, Installation and Implementation of Prime Mission Product in support of ONE-NET infrastructure acquisitions. Transition of ONE-NET into NNE will result in a fully integrated, single Navy network with unclassified and classified enclaves operated via a controlled Network Management System that will be compatible with the Joint Information Environment (JIE) and Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA) objectives.
[Base Level Information Infrastructure (BLII) ORT Cyber Remediation] ORT Cyber Remediation FY16 funding will be used to upgrade and sustain current Information Assurance / security technologies deployed on the OCONUS network such as firewalls, virtual private networks, authentications, cryptographic log-ons, and network segregation. Additional details held at a higher level.
[OCONUS/CONUS Piers Tech Refresh/Integration] Piers / Enterprise Pier Connectivity Architecture (EPCA): FY16 funding will be used to upgrade existing End of Life (EOL) infrastructure (routers, switches, servers, etc...) based on a single solution, more specifically EPCA v2.0, for 3 CONUS pier locations (Naval Station SD, Naval Air Station NI, Naval Submarine Bases SD) and 2 OCONUS locations (Singapore and Korea). This technical refresh will allow for the transition of Piers/EPCA into a single global Navy Enterprise Network (NEN).
[Base Level Informtation Infrastructure (BLII) Production Support ] FY16 Production Support funding is required to support the technical refresh of Prime Mission Product to ensure all required installation plans and documentation are developed, contractor deliverables are tracked for completeness and receipt; site coordination, equipment procurement, and shipment is accomplished and project milestones are tracked and reflected in the project POAM's.
[CONUS/OCONUS Piers Production Support] FY16 Production Support funding is required to support the technical refresh of Prime Mission Product to ensure all required installation plans and documentation are developed, contractor deliverables are tracked for completeness and receipt; site coordination, equipment procurement, and shipment is accomplished and project milestones are tracked and reflected in the project POAM's.

proc:Name.footnote: 1. Telephony quantities represent number of regions. Unit cost fluctuations are a result of the varying locations/sites per region. The increase in cost is a result of the number of sites in these regions, the various site architecture and requirements, the age and type of system modernization, locations of the sites (CONUS/OCONUS), and user density (number of users). FY16 unit cost increases significantly because the two FY16 funded regions include 11 CONUS and OCONUS sites, versus the two FY15 funded regions which include only 9 CONUS sites.

Program requirements include: Voicemail Systems, Voice over Internet Protocol (VoIP), Voice over Secure Internet Protocol (VoSIP), Video Teleconferencing over Internet Protocol (VTCoIP), Video Teleconferencing over Secure Internet Protocol (VTCoSIP), Telephony systems infrastructure (e.g. cable plant), and Telephony Management Systems (TMS). Telephony system installations and/or upgrades occur at facilities in accordance with requirements as identified by Navy Information Dominance Forces (NAVIDFOR), Office of the Chief of Naval Operations (OPNAV), and Missile Defense Agency (MDA) (i.e. FLTNOCs, Fleet Telecommunications sites, and Aegis Ashore Sites).

proc:LineItem.proc:Description:
Next Generation Enterprise Network (NGEN) is an enterprise network which will provide secure, net-centric data and services to Navy and Marine Corps personnel and represents the continuous evolution of information technology at the Department of Navy (DoN). NGEN forms the foundation for the DoN's future Naval Network Environment that will be interoperable with and leverage other Department of Defense-provided Net-Centric Enterprise Services. Prior to FY15, funding for NGEN was budgeted under OPN LI 8161 NGEN (IT210).
[P5 / NGEN - Technical Refresh (TR)]: Funds will continue procurement of TR required for all equipment "behind the wall plug" in accordance with the NGEN Technical Refresh Plan (TRP), and the repair components required to support the network. Following the transition from the Continuation of Services Contract (CoSC) to the NGEN contract in FY15, all assets are Government Owned / Contractor Operated (GO/CO) and procurement of these assets will continue in FY16 and the out years.
[P5 / NGEN - Operation Rolling Tide - ORT]: The funding will buy upgrades to router infrastructure, provide data feeds in support of security event detection and defensive cyber operations, provide Host Based Security System (HBSS) infrastructure stability, protection of security logs, the administration of NMCI resources through alternative "off network" means to dramatically reduce attack surface, upgrade active directory to incorporate security enhancements, provision NMCI outlook web access to accommodate non CAC enforced login and activate data loss prevention capability in HBSS to limit migration and exfiltration of Navy data.
proc:LineItem.proc:Justification:
The FY 2016 funding request was reduced by $15.0 million to account for the availability of prior year execution balances.
Funding for NGEN was realigned from Line Item 8161 in the FY15 President's Budget submission.
In FY16 the Next Generation Enterprise Network (NGEN) will utilize the funding to pay for the NGEN Tech Refresh Plan (TRP) and Operation Rolling Tide (ORT).

proc:LineItem.proc:Description: The FY 2016 funding request was reduced by $13.1 million to account for the availability of prior year execution balances. The Spares budget provides for the initial spares, outfitting spares, and vendor direct spares for equipment financed in OPN BAs 1-7.
